Title: MANK
Comments: Cinephiles will be in ecstasy and, yes, the film does look and sound gorgeous. Unfortunately despite some excellent performances (including TVs Cormoran Strike as the young Orsen Welles) the film is tedious to the extreme. Prepare to be bored rigid!

Title: MANK
Comments: I respect Fincher very much and wouldn't say this film disappointed me. Cinematography, acting, plot - all were great, in my opinion. However, I can't ignore the notable lack of empathy I felt for the characters. That doesn't bother me personally, because since the visuals are more than satisfactory, in a way they compensate for the lack of relatability in the characters. It's not one of his best movies, but it's still much better than many of the Hollywood productions today.

Title: MANK
Comments: While showcasing a very good performance by the great Gary Oldman along with stylish directing (it's David Fincher) overall the experience of watching this film was shallow and a bit of a slog. While the story on paper is interesting, as anyone who's remotely interested in filmmaking would like to know the behind-the-scenes of arguably the most influential and acclaimed film of all time, unfortunately it suffers majorly from lack of structural cohesion and uninteresting characters.I just couldn't find myself all that invested in the characters, other than Mank, not even knowing who was being referred to or what exactly was happening in quite a few scenes. The film tends to jump around very erratically between locations and dialogues between characters and feels way too long with a very stretched-out plot. Ironically, a dilemma in the film is of people complaining to Mank that his screenplay leaps back and forth in time very messily and is hard to follow. Citizen Kane's time jumping was necessary and interesting throughout, unlike this.Still there was enjoyment to be had, but coming from Fincher, I had a surprising lack of investment in what was happening and found myself pretty bored at times.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Somehow a film with a good cast, director and premise ends up being incredibly dull. Many references to cinematic greats names has, I'm sure, in part, contributed to the critics raving reviews.
I'm a fan of classic cinema but too much style over any substance

Title: MANK
Comments: Inaccurate, uneven, and a rushed biased ending I'm still trying to get over.I'm very familiar with old hollywood, in particular with the present time this film is projecting. I appreciated the filmmakers had an affinity for this era as well. I found, personally, where they would introduce a plethora ("do you know what a plethora is?") of the persons of old Hollywood to be overhanded and distracting. Full name to full name to full name at a fast paced editing was dizzying. I could barely keep up and I'm pretty well versed. I can only imagine those unfamiliar trying to keep up.The story should be simple, but it was hard to find in this bogged down drivel of the first half. It was mostly told in flashbacks during this time instead of centering us with where we're supposed to currently be at and with whom, being Mank, so once we care we can then properly go with him to discover more to the "why" and "how" he came to this point in his life.Structure aside. The second half is where I woke up. There were some brilliant moments with corrected pacing that allows the scenes and actors of Oldman's caliber to breathe. I really enjoyed his performance. Amanda Seyfried, as Marion Davies, was the breath of fresh air for the film. She had that rare glow where she was truly the living/breathing character she was embodying and not just putting on a performance.I have a confession: I've been a huge fan of Trent Reznor since 1990. His scores with Atticus for Dragon Tattoo, Social Network, and Gone Girl were some of the best of the 21st, so I was expecting nothing less here. I read where they only used instruments of the era (that might be a grapevine thing). I think that's very commendable but truthfully didn't feel it translated well here. It was largely forgettable, which pains me to say. This is just from the first viewing.I really enjoyed the cinematogaphy and the choice for the black and white film (I assume it was film). Loved the reel change marks throughout. There was a shot near the opening that did a slow fade to all but a lighted room, which I thought was a nice touch. The film had a lot of promise. The weight of it for me was in the last quarter. The film was a comedy for awhile there, then somehow a touch of a political thriller, before finally getting to where it wanted to be, which was a story about a man's life.I've read where it was actually Mank's brother that was tied into the political drama about Upton. I understand creative licensing and the need for suspension for disbelief, but it's a hard turn off for me when I begin to think that there's crucial parts of the story here that people will take down as fact. Stripping the writer from the birthplace (if you will) of the "Rosebud" construct seemed completely unnecessary. It's been well documented where that came from and his use of it in Kane is utter brilliance. Don't know what the creative choice was there to ruin it.What it all came down to for me and my rating of a 3 out of 10 had nothing to do with the technical side or the performances, which were quite captivating (I was amazed at the voice of Orson); it was a disagreement with some of the choices that were made in the script. The very uneven first half that mostly consisted of flashbacks, keeping us from anchoring, and the choices in the last 20 minutes.The dialogue was sheer brilliance in areas and seemed too overhanded and self aware in others. My problem was that I've seen interviews and read many articles about Orson to know he's the one to make sure Herman got his credit; so much so his name was listed above his own. He also gave Gregg Toland his due in the credits although Orson had his fingers in everything.Orson Welles didn't even need the film to cement his name. He had the 1938 broadcast of War of the Worlds that stirred the nation, the all-black play if Macbeth he oversaw in Harlem that overhauled Shakespeare's witchcraft with voodoo and had lines around the block. Everything he touched turned to gold, especially when there was source material. Mank provided the story and Orson did what he's always done and rewrote it into oblivion until it was ready. It was a team effort, and they created the draft for the "great American motion picture". If he didn't get the writing credit, it would make more sense to the story and create an empathy that would carry more weight."It's pretty, but is it art?"

Title: MANK
Comments: All you have to know is that it is a "that streaming service" film so be ready to see not the best movie of one of greatest director. Enjoy!

Title: MANK
Comments: I struggled to stay awake to the end of Mank directed by David Fincher on Netflix. It's an unmitigated disaster, confused and turgid from beginning to end. For example, in one part, a guy, Shelly Metcalf--who?--commits suicide, but the next scene shows the funeral of another guy, Irving Thalberg! Duh? Wha? Half the time you can't figure out which woman is Mank's wife, Sara, and which is his British amanuensis, Rita.The only good thing you can say about it is that Gary Oldman, an actor I've never heard of, will probably get at least an Oscar nomination for best actor because he's in every scene, most of the time playing a tousle-haired drunk. As if playing a tousle-haired drunk is original! Duh? Wha?The best acting in the film was by Amanda Seyfried, who plays William Randolph Hearst's mistress, Marion Davies. But even she gets short shrift and lost in the shuffle. Orson Wells--Tom Burke--doesn't even show up in person until 14 minutes from the end. This is not a spoiler.Bottom line: you are led to believe by the hype and publicity that this film is going to be about how the greatest American film ever made, Citizen Kane, was made. You would be wrong. Citizen Kane is not even mentioned once and there are only fleeting references to it.Mank is, essentially, the biopic of a drunk who died of alcoholism at the age of 55.Di-sas-ter!

Title: MANK
Comments: Wow what a pretentious piece of dribble. The dialogue was straight out of a Hollywood Golden Age movie where every one speaks in a rat-ta-tat manner, that no one ever really did in real life. Mank is not likable or interesting even though Oldman does a great job with what he has been giving. The art direction and costumes are top notch and Amanda Siegfried is stunning as Hearst's lover Marion Davies. That's the best i can say about this snoozer of a movie.

Title: MANK
Comments:
I enjoyed the movie until Mank got out of bad.
I didn't find the Sinclair for Governor stuff at all believable. The film provided no reason that Mankiewicz would go all crazy over the defeat or the way that politics was played in 1934.
I did enjoy the Marion Davies parts. A true story movie based on her and Hearst and would have been far more interesting.

Title: MANK
Comments: 'Mank' is a dull, uninspiring movie that says "William Randolph Hearst was wrong" on paper, yet validates his cynical 'organ grinder monkey' parable in practice. A bloated, self-important, inoffensive product brought to you by the same Hollywood corporate class Herman Mankiewicz hated. It's as phony as computer-generated scratches on digital black and white photography.Director David Fincher says he has "complicated" feelings about Hollywood, but judging by this movie, his approach to the industry is not really that complicated. He wants to play with big, shiny toys while making stuff that's smarter and riskier than your average superhero flick, but he has no real problem with the industry status quo. Sure, he's aware of how condescending and two-faced people in the industry can be, how unethical and corrupt the business is, how rotten the politics are. Here, let him show you how aware he is in this multi-million dollar Netflix-produced movie starring A-list actors. Make no mistake: Fincher is a ride-or-die Hollywood director. Like most pop stylists who came up in the 90's, irony and contempt is simply part of his love language. That's probably why the 'heartfelt' moments in this movie - Sara's scenes with Mank, the conclusion of Rita's storyline - come off as disingenuous and flat.I would say Fincher doesn't have the guts to be Mankiewicz, but I'm not so sure Mank had much courage anyway. He wasn't a real socialist, and his decision to blacklist himself reads more like a petty middle finger than a redemptive act of selflessness. That's to say nothing of his misogynistic revenge on Marion Davies - a betrayal this movie claims she was okay with. (Sidenote: All the women in this movie are underwritten and have an inexplicably high tolerance for Mank's B. S.)No, the person whose guts I measure Fincher's against is the person 'Mank' wants you to think about the least. It's telling how the story of a sad, bored Hollywood insider appeals to Fincher, but he can't get near the story of Orson Welles, an earnest outsider artist who outclassed (and was subsequently buried by) Hollywood. That's because Fincher is not an outsider, he's not a 'punk auteur,' nor is he an 'anarchist' as some film bros like to describe him. When Levi's, Nike, Coca-Cola, and Chanel trust you with tens of millions of dollars, when Netflix gives you an exclusive four-year deal, how much of a threat to the system can you be?Watching 'Mank,' two things have never been more clear:1) Hollywood still has not forgiven Orson Welles, and 2) Fincher is quite comfortable being the organ grinder's smug, self-effacing, jaded monkey.At what point does a cranky, bitter takedown of Hollywood hypocrisy become a cowardice compensator?

Title: MANK
Comments: What did I just watch? Fell asleep in ten minutes the first two times I tried to watch it. The third time I was able to stay awake throughout, only to realize I had lost two hours of my life that I can never get back. What a snooze fest of a movie. Then again, Fincher is one the most overrated directors of modern cinema so I'm not surprised.

Title: MANK
Comments: The writing reflects the talent and verbal aesthetics of the featured historical character accurately, charged by witty literacy as you would wish. Gary Oldman masterfully sustains the character he inhabits. Slowly, surely you are experiencing Herman Mankiiewicz as the featured actor becomes the featured character in fullness. This is art. Additionally, the emphasis placed on W. H. Hearst is necessary because of plot demands and "through-line" purposes, but featuring Upton Sinclair's socialist presence in California's political culture through his influence on Mankiewicz displays Mank, the "court jester" as a man with a serious political conscience dwelling in a space unfriendly to his deeply felt principles. "Mank" proves a theatrical gift by David Fincher, Ben Mankiewicz, the writer, Oldman's co star Amanda Seafried, and supporting cast, and the production crew who left us with a an accurate feel for 1930's back lots, sound stages, and the Mojave Desert where a cinematic masterpiece was written.

Title: MANK
Comments: Dull, pretentious, self-important biopic that lacks the energy and wit that were Mankiewicz's trademarks. The real Mank wouldn't allow his name on the credits of this one.

Title: MANK
Comments: I was so surprised by this movie. It was like being transported into the 1930s/40s. Everything from the dialogue to the way people moved and how it was shot was so 1930s. Probably the most surprising part of the movie is its nod to the current situation in the US - including fake news...To my mind this is a masterpiece. It should definitely feature in the Oscars. And Gary Oldman must be nominated for best actor.

Title: MANK
Comments: I'm sorry. This movie is nominated for a Golden Globe? Really? I tried to watch this on two separate nights and fell asleep both times. I am a movie buff and a fan of Citizen Kane, so I was looking forward to it.

Title: MANK
Comments: Such a boring movie. If the name Fincher weren't tagged in this film, no one would care watching it. Screenplay wise, this doesn't deserve to be in Oscars.

Title: MANK
Comments: This year we lacked quality movies or the experience of a good picture at the minimum, but this film did great at impressing me, giving a very great noir nostalgia.All round it was good at the least very good at the best, Gary did an amazing job at performing Mank's unique character, picking Marion Davies for Orson is perfect! his sound was very on point that if you close your eyes you'll think it's Welles himself.The best part in the movie is FINCHER, astonishing, shooting the movie the same way as Orson shot Citizen Kane impressed me and was the best part of the movie loved every part of the flashbacks even though some was extended that made it boring, but still the finchers did a great job and a movie that we really needed this weak cinematic year (but was good in real life).

Title: MANK
Comments: It was an interesting set up to begin with and certain scenes were amusing but unfortunately the political debate scene made me cringe."Socialism is spreading the wealth and communism is spreading the poverty" with the other characters clearly being framed to be pro capitalism, they are all presented as "greedy" while mank is the righteous one.I love films that challenge you and make you re-think you assumptions and thoughts but this is just getting tiresome and clearly not needed but was introduced for political purposes. No thought out explanation, just nonsense.

Title: MANK
Comments:
The performances were great. Especially Seyfried's and Oldman's. The references are simply phenomenal when it comes to real life and when it comes to Citizen Kane itself.
Fincher did a b&w movie that it really seems like it was made 80 years ago, and it's actually very fun to watch.
For me, the great point of the performances it's definitely Amanda Seyfried. She doesn't have much time on screen, and when she's not, you wish she was, and I think that's the foundation of a great performance in a supporting role.

Title: MANK
Comments: I'm no expert on 1930s cinema by all means. If you aren't either, I wouldn't recommend this flick. Has it's great moments, starts pretty good, but in my opinion, looses it self by desperately trying to appeal to critics and media. I enjoyed myself sometimes, but 80% of the movie I was completely lost, not understanding a word characters were saying... But if you know cinema's history like you know your house, you're not going to regret it.

Title: MANK
Comments: I thoroughly enjoyed this film - while probably some things inaccurate - it was a great watch with some outstanding acting. I felt it really caught the period well with a modern twist.The dining room scene was a masterpeiece of cinema.

Title: MANK
Comments:
"This is a business where the buyer gets nothing but a memory for his money,what he bought still belongs to the man that sold it" says Mayer,co-founder of MGM studios which runs as one of the glaring themes of this technical juggernaut from the legendary David Fincher and serves as a reminder that a film will always been known by the person who made it.Herman J. Mankiewicz,a gifted but rather brazen screenwriter with an exquisite way with words, battles his demons of alcoholism and compulsive gambling to finish the screenplay for the film 'Citizen Cane' within the stipulated time span which is to be helmed by Orsen Wells. However,David Fincher doesn't limit his narrative to Mank's involvement with the film which proved to be revolutionary in terms of writing and making,he proliferates into his personal turmoil and exposes the hypocrisy of the major Hollywood production houses in the run.
Gary Oldman who is 60 years of age in real life, nonchalantly reprises the bloated alcoholic lead who is nearly half his actual age to near perfection. The tenacity of the plot coupled with impeccable cinematography augments the narrative a notch higher making up for the rather tardy start to the movie. 'Mank' may not be one of Fincher's best, it appears rather like a loving son's respectable homage to his father's most ambitious project. The technical and narrative proficiency of David Fincher which the audience is accustomed to is far from seen in this flick.That being said,the film cannot be written off as bad,from a director known for his meticulously structured psychological sequences and exemplary technical skills,Mank have have fallen short of the high expectations. However, the ominous performances from the lead actors and some good writing makes this film a good watch. Keeping in mind the fewer releases the year had,Mank may even land David Fincher his long overdue Academy award (fingers crossed).

Title: MANK
Comments: This movie showed us that although the shell is the most beautiful thing in the world that you see, it's content and purpose is more disposable than a bad apple.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Mank is a movie for Hollywood insiders. That's not to say others will not like this but if you are not familiar with the real life people portrayed in this film you may lose interest.It was very well done and the style really transported you into 1930's Hollywood. Be aware this movie is shot entirely in black and white, and our critics were split, with some loving that and some not so much. So this may be a turn off for certain viewers. The music and score of this was incredible and our favorite part was they way they portrayed the movie making process of that time period.We recommend you check this movie out but before you do you may want to watch "Citizen Kane." If you already saw it, maybe at least read up about the people and series of events that took place to be more aware of the name dropping throughout the movie. It will help you enjoy this movie on the same level we think the filmmakers intended.This review was a combination and average of our 4 critics. Individual ratings are listed and for more details watch our show on YouTube... The Entertainment Jungle.
Individual Ratings: Cornelius - (7.5 out of 10); Ryan The Lion - (7.0 out of 10); Number 66 - (4.5 out of 10); Quackrine - (5.5 out of 10); Average - (6.125 out of 10)

Title: MANK
Comments: The movie is well made with good performances scattered throughout, but the issue with Mank is that it feels underwhelming. During the movie we are told the story of Herman Mankiewicz, a Hollywood screenwriter, and his inspiration for his magnum opus Citizen Kane. The movie honestly feels empty, without a true purpose or reason for being made. I understand that it's a passion project for Fincher, but that's not enough to forgive its flaws.

Title: MANK
Comments: A reviewer here said "a self-absorbed film that doesn't care about it's audience". I agree but not for negative reasons. This is exceptional work from Fincher. An excellent film about Hollywood of the past and one of its most genius and flawed individuals Herman J. Mankiewicz, played sensationally by Gary Oldman.Oldman is at his true best here. Playing the drunken writer he was born to play. An intelectual, gambler, drunk and witty gentleman that wrote Citizen Kane. Oldman (with his own troubled past) is perfectly cast in the role.Set design, support cast, cinematography and just about everything in this film is perfect. I watched it on Netflix and as soon as it was over, I watched it again. Sure it divides audiences. But I think that's what makes it so good.Pure cinema at its best!

Title: MANK
Comments: Having worked with David Fincher on "Zodiac" & having interviewed Amanda Seyfried for "In Time" and Lily Collins in "Rules Don't Apply", I was very curious.I do love Gary Oldman's work ever since "Bram Stoker's Dracula".Oldman becomes Herman J. Mankiewicz & delivers an outstanding performance. Thinking about his wit, speeches and his behavior makes me still crack up.Arliss Howard makes an excellent Louis B. Mayer and I adore Tom Burke as Americas beloved Artist Orson Welles.The whole Cast and Crew does not spare with Sparks during this #2020 Netflix production, like Magnum P. I. revving hup his Ferrari 308 GTS.Being one of the German speaking Actors not having made it into "Beerfest", I was jealous of missing out on this Hollywood extravaganza.In my opinion my SAGAFTRA sisters and brothers as well as Union and Non Union Crew and Cast have created a unique master piece.Hollywood pulls out all the stops before during the VOD streaming, pandemic afterglow.Chapeau, Congratulations & Namaste.Enjoy the movie with a hot and glamorous date, decked out in a dress  la Marion Davies by Trish Summerville; cigar, some Cognac and Popcorn.Once time travel is properly established, get into your DeLorean in order to get cast in "Touch of Evil". You already bought your ticket - enjoy the ride!

Title: MANK
Comments: There are great elements. Great acting, well written dialogue, cinematography. But there was really no point and it was dull. Making movies about movies is favourite subject of every movie maker. Please stop

Title: MANK
Comments: Kept waiting for something noteworthy to happen...with about 30 minutes remaining turned it off to resume later....still trying to generate enough interest to finish it. Folks in Hollywood who make movies and film students will probably appreciate it...I'm neither.

Title: MANK
Comments: If you are a lover of old movies and interested in the studio era and Hollywood era then this film is for you! It's beautifully filmed in the style of an old movie using all the old film style techniques and music to add suspense. Fabulous acting! I can understand the bad reviews because if you watch this film not having any knowledge of the industry or time period then it may not hold your interest! As a lover of films I found I had to really concentrate at times but I kept going and I'm glad I did as it gave me more insight into the truth behind the power struggle for writers during this time period and how Citizen Kane was not just all about Orson Welles!! Definitely worth a watch!

Title: MANK
Comments: One hour and twenty minutes were enough to say I don't understand what's going on, who are they talking about or what are they thinking. It looks like this movie was written for the guys involved in this old film studios and productions, who by the way, are probably dead. I wasn't there because I'm 40 and I wanted to know and understand how Citizen Kane was done but confusion was the only thing I've got by watching this one. I'm still trying to understand what was the whole point of this movie. Too many names, to much information and nothing clear to the common audience. I was so lost that I needed to stop watching this movie with more than 40 minutes left. Would be surprised if it gets an Oscar.

Title: MANK
Comments: Absolutely seething having sat through 2+ hours of that - both wrapped in its own Hollywood self importance plus nowhere near as intelligent as it thinks it is. Don't get me wrong, there is an interesting story in there, but frankly it's worthy of a 30 minute documentary, not a 2 hour 12 minute rambling motion picture. While director David Fincher may have loved working on his Dad's unfinished screen play that was never published while he was alive, I think we now know why - it's awful, difficult to follow and hideously over long. At least we have Gary Oldman to watch while we try and get through it, basically the films only redeeming feature. It even looks cheap!! Avoid.

Title: MANK
Comments: For me as a cinema fan, but not having studied hollywoods history too much in depth, this film was really hard to follow. Without a doubt it is very well directed and well played, but it never really get's emotional or interesting on other levels then film politics.

Title: MANK
Comments:
David Fincher has more than enough A-Level experience to deliver this Hollywood insider powerhouse. Political commentary of the 1930's comes to full-circle-relevance for our current time, against the joyously-romantic visuals of cinema's golden age. Oldman is delightful; the sharp-tongued dialogue elevates the piece. Technique delivers everything you'd expect from Fincher.
A captivating time-capsule romantic period study. My 2020 best picture pick bar none.

Title: MANK
Comments: The fact that Upton Sinclair is portrayed as merely the victim of political propaganda and not THE pioneer of modern socialist propaganda, betrays the film's lack of any historical context and lack of any sense of irony.

Title: MANK
Comments: The material is good, the production design superb, the acting abs directing flawless.But the writing, god the writing... it's excruciatingly slow-paced, the flashbacks don't help (you'd expect they might), nothing helps. It's a terrible bore. And it's not because it's long: it started and ended boring: boring after 20 minutes and it doesn't get better.I though of Psycho actually: that it only became a classic because it was so heavily edited. Maybe that's what'd do it for Mank: a heavy handed editor.Try it if you're a die hard Citizen Kane fan. Or a Gary Oldman fan. Or have nothing better to do.

Title: MANK
Comments: Every shot is beautiful. The sound design is excellent, it sounds better than 180gr vinyl. As a conservative who loves movies and history I was very disappointed at how inaccurate it was. Several prominent plot points are made up or misrepresented. Pretty ballsy to make a movie about how politicized media can purposely mislead the public that is politicized media purposely misleading the public. I was very excited for this movie and ended up annoyed and disappointed. A waste of top notch cinematography and sound talent.

Title: MANK
Comments: This movie is so boring, it will cure anyone's insomnia. Even the few examples of decent acting won't keep you awake. Sorry.

Title: MANK
Comments: As someone else wrote here, this was a chore to watch. Gorgeous opening shots setting a visual tone that continued throughout. But endless speeches directed at no one in particular... nonlinear story for no apparent reason... really oddball, echoey sound that made one think they were sitting in a 40s movie theater, with none of the charm... Off-putting and annoying. Kane and Mankiewicz deserved far better.

Title: MANK
Comments:
So, let's start with the assumption that Mank is a great movie.
The soundtrack is fantastic, the sets, costumes, and makeup as well.
Erik Messerschmidt's cinematography is exceptional (the film manages to be a film of the 40s and at the same time a film of 2000).
Even the editing, as in every Fincher film, is excellent and manages to find a way to merge with the fictional sound of the 30s on several occasions.
That said, what's wrong with Mank?
In my opinion, the weak link in a film that had the possibility of being a masterpiece, exactly like the film from which it is inspired, is undoubtedly the script. Obviously, I am not referring to the perfectly written dialogues or the numerous insightful lines in the film, I am referring precisely to the structure of the story and the different elements that are treated in it: in fact, what seems to want to be a story about the screenwriter of Citizen Kane, ends up by transform into a glimpse of the Hollywood of the 30s / 40s.
Nothing strange up to here,
except that the script to implement this maneuver goes against its own nature, showing more than it should, but less than it really should (especially from a political point of view).
In fact, a boundless number of characters from the American political and social history of the time are mentioned, who, however, are introduced in a hasty and almost fast way.
The consequence of this oversight is the inevitable presence of a huge number of characters who are deepened in an incredibly superficial way.
So the film, especially in the first part, gets "lost" and easily disoriented, leading to a not too satisfying ending.
Despite everything, Amanda Seyfried and Gary Oldman are fantastic in their roles and Fincher's directing is perhaps the most flawless of his career.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Following a couple of good reviews in the paper, we decided to put it on the must watch list.I'm a bit of a movie buff but after about an hour I was hoping it would pick up and be more interesting.
But this is really an Arthouse / indie style movie targeted at film historians and about 45 min too long.
Unlike Trumbo it doesn't really grip the average joe. The unfolding of the true meaning of the parable of the monkey and organ grinder mentioned early in the movie is interesting but to build an entire movie around it is hard to justify.Sorry , was hoping for more.

Title: MANK
Comments: What a disappointment. Was really hoping for quality. Yet only to find a overly wordy script poorly delivered. Also general audio was low compared to most other films. Cinematography was top though.

Title: MANK
Comments: One of the most boring movie that I have ever seen

Title: MANK
Comments:
Mank ~ 6/10
I hate to watch something and I do not know its content.
Perhaps because of my lack of knowledge of the period the film is speaking,
But despite that, the anecdotal film is below average,
Transitions between the present and the past become troublesome over time.
The two enhancements to the film were the direction by David and the acting by Charles and Gary.

Title: MANK
Comments:
I thought this movie was wonderful, either because of the great way the story is told or because of how Fincher makes it possible for us to link the content and relate each part of the film to the Citizen Kane script and still enjoy the story.
Mank's staging fascinated me, but I was even more fascinated by Gary Oldman's brilliant performance, this man joins the film, he is the film. Thanks to his brilliant performance I think he deserves the Best Actor Oscar this year (competing with Chadwick Boseman for his great performance in Ma Rainey's black bottom).
Mank is a masterpiece, maybe not David Fincher's best film, but it's still a majestic film. Maybe a lot of people are upset that the film has factors that aren't very Fincher-like, but personally it doesn't bother me at all.
Thanks for the movie David Fincher, a total wonder.

Title: MANK
Comments:
I like this movie
It's wonderful in every thing.. Acting, cinematography, production design, music, diricting..
But the screenplay is slow, it make me boring sometimes

Title: MANK
Comments: I love David Fincher, he is my favorite director for me, and this movie was not in the usual David Fincher style, but the film was acceptable, and the acting was also impressive. I enjoyed every minute of this movie and I hope this movie will get many awardsEspecially the Academy Award for Best Director by David Fincher

Title: MANK
Comments: Gary Oldman does an excellent performance, David Fincher does a great job as a director, the photography is great, but the plot lacked a bit of movement.

Title: MANK
Comments: At first the movie started slow but the the second act sucked you in. This at a critical time of our present elections. Couldn't tell but either way the connection was established. This movie yes on the surface is about Mank and the studio operations but even more so a tale of a few powerful White men giving birth to the idea of lording over the many so much so that even today we see the fruits of that philosophy with the 75 million followers of Trump. Have to see it again. So much underneath.

Title: MANK
Comments: Caught this film this past weekend and really enjoyed Oldman's portrayal of the screenwriter. I also enjoyed learning some of the backstory behind the making of Cane, which is one of my all time favorite films. Really recommend to fans of filmmaking history.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Aside for the amazing aesthetics and the overall nostalgia for 30's and 40's Hollywood, Fincher got lost on this one.
It's almost unwatchable for anyone who hasn't watched Citizen Kane and isn't informed on Hollywood from this era. A good movie is supposed to include you even if you're not aware on the historics of the movie or an Hollywood worker, and that's the biggest failure of Mank.
Still well done as a Fincher movie, but not as exciting as any of his other works. Not a misstep, but more of an underline in an amazing line of movies.Nostalgia and insider references will only get you so far. Concentrating on Hearst and how it transpires on the script would have made for a much more dramatically successful movie.

Title: MANK
Comments: This is a very good-looking piece of garbage.! Sorry, your review is too short.(Not anymore it isn't)

Title: MANK
Comments: I thought this had a great premise but turned out to be a huge disappointment. Nothing redeeming about this snoozefest.

Title: MANK
Comments: "Mank" was Boring as "Citizen kane" was!I didn't like both of them. Although acting was great but I think the story was main problem. Also I didn't like flashbacks.

Title: MANK
Comments: Another brilliant masterpiece from the one and only David Fincher...

Title: MANK
Comments: I lost 2.5 hours of my life. For the first time in a long time I wanted to leave, but I wasn't alone so I stayed, it was very painful.

Title: MANK
Comments: It had such potential. With the likes of George S Kaufman, Charlie Lederer, SJ Perlman, Ben Hecht, and the like we had none of their wit or humor. We were stuck with a miserable washed up Herman J Mankiwiecz, an egomaniacle Orson Welles, and a power hungry Louis B Mayer. I'm assuming that was the point of the film. But it was sad and pathetic and didn't engage me. Marion Davies and William Randolph Hearst were the highlights of the film, but were too little to carry the film. I get that Gary Oldman was playing an old sloppy drunk. But it came across as boring and lazy. And in the end I'm not even sure what the theme of the film was supposed to be. I guess I just wish the film had focused on someone else and maybe call it Hearst vs Kane or something.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Nothing about this movie deserves awards or massive praise, but it's enjoyable and interesting.
The first 30 minutes are a bit confused and uninteresting but the last 60 minutes are a good ride with some fun moments. The whole movie is full of great one liners, but it suffers from a feeling that the movie written about the past was created with morality and sensibilities of 2020.

Title: MANK
Comments:
The screenplay, the environment, the detail of that time, the cinematography, the actors, the direction...this is David Finchers best movie so far.
And i do understand that there are also a lot of people who disliked this film. I think thats mainly because of the witty dialogues and names that are thrown at the viewer.This movie doenst explain certain characters or situations. This movie demands that the viewer did his homework or at least knows something about hollywood in the 40's.

Title: MANK
Comments:
I completely "got" what the filmmaker was trying to accomplish. His technique mirrors the original Kane movie. Short scenes, fades and flashbacks.
It was enjoyable enough on my own screen. However I predict that this film, and many others that were released in 2020, will have a second life in theaters. People will be anxious to get back into theater seats and see these films on a big screen.
I would suggest a program handout at the door explaining who all the various characters are that are played in the film.

Title: MANK
Comments: They should have shot it on 35mm film. It says mono mix

Title: MANK
Comments: A movie for cinephiles. It looks and feels like a mid-century film so if you are not familiar with old movies, you may not like the pacing, plot development, appearance or cinematography. And the reel change marks ("cigarette burns" at top right) are a wonderful touch. The start of the next reel is often a scene change, as it would be in a movie from the 1940s. Oldman is fantastic as always.

Title: MANK
Comments: I don't know if I'm alone here but i was just very confused by the plot. I didn't understand any of it from start to finish. The cinematography and Amanda Seyfried's performance were fantastic but otherwise, bland

Title: MANK
Comments: I'll keep it concise. For one, the cinematography is gorgeous, it truly takes you back in time to the 1930s. Nice acting although Welles' portrayal seemed a bit too unremarkable. No real conflict and you would have to be somewhat well versed in the names and context the movie takes place in to get invested with the story. Oldman is magnificent as usual. As an homage this movie is okay. Give it a try and make your own conclusions. 74/100

Title: MANK
Comments: Let me start off by saying that this movie is not going to be for everyone, and I fully understand if anyone ends up feeling bored or dislikes the movie. It's wordy, complicated and doesn't try to push the audience in any particular direction. I however loved it.There are very few things Mank doesn't achieve in an almost perfect fashion, this is a passion project and a love letter of the highest caliber. The acting is superb all around, Gary Oldman delivers one of his absolute best roles ever perfectly embodying the tormented but talented Mank, Seyfried shines as a cleverer than you think movie star and everyone else helps you forget you're not watching the real persons themselves.The biggest highlight of this movie however is the incredible visuals, the best cinematography Oscar is practically in the bag already. Very seldom do you watch something that so perfectly captures a different era, this one being of the old Hollywoodland, with great compositions, lighting and mood this is truly a feast for the eyes in every possible way! I truly felt transported to another world and what i wouldn't do to experience that old Hollywood glamour just for one night, corruption and backstabbing aside!There are many more things to discuss but I'll leave it to you to experience this firsthand, overall this is an excellent return to the big screen for David Fincher and Im beyond excited to see what he can cook up next. Highly recommend!Score: 9/10

Title: MANK
Comments: If you want to watch a thriller/crime movie (like Fincher normally makes) I don't think this is the movie for you, if you have already watched and liked Citizen Kane, interested in cinema history, know the presented persons (if you don't you can google them like I did, probably you're watching on Netflix and can pause it after all) I think you would like Mank.By far Mank is the most comfortable film (for audience) Fincher ever made. Of course he didn't compromise the high quality of the production. You can enjoy clever dialogues, wonderful acting (especially by Gary Oldman), beautiful cinematography... I didn't get bored for a moment (may be the last part could have been a little bit longer, it ends very quickly)Compared to the high quality of the production, the plot is a little bit weak I think. Yeah, the time jumps are nice but I have concerns about depth of the story. Mank more likely deepens Citizen Kane's story rather than its own.

Title: MANK
Comments: Was expecting more of old Hollywood plus inside background before went into Citizen Kane evolution which turned out to be minimal.

Title: MANK
Comments: This felt like a documentary. I found myself looking up historical facts about Citizen Kane screen writing and controversies. Film critics will love this movie, it's made for them.

Title: MANK
Comments: Superb acting from Amanda Seyfried and Gary Oldman. Mediocre storytelling and lots of references to 1930s and 1940s Hollywood. The film also depicts the California Gubernatorial Election of 1937 in the sidelines.

Title: MANK
Comments: Superb acting from Amanda Seyfried and Gary Oldman. However, mediocre storytelling and lots of references to 1930s and 1940s Hollywood. The film also depicts the 1934 California Gubernatorial Election in the sidelines.

Title: MANK
Comments:
It's certainly beautifully shot in delicious, creamy black and white but I found it to be a self-obsessed piece of film making and as a result it left me feeling uninvolved. The characters are unsympathetic, especially the titular one however well Gary Oldman played him. The screenplay was written by David Fincher's father and that's quite possibly why I found it to be more of a vanity project than the cinematic masterpiece it aspires to be, with more than a whiff of nepotism about it. There's no real drama to this piece and it starts to become wearisome about halfway through. The actual script writing of 'Citizen Kane' (or 'American' as it was originally titled) strangely takes a supporting role to the writer's alcoholic self-loathing and the internal politics and machinations of the Hollywood elite at that time. I found it to be uneven and considering Fincher's previous excellent bodies of work it left me feeling somewhat dispirited.
Obviously this is just my opinion and I'm sure that a lot of people will love it!

Title: MANK
Comments: I wonder how many of the people who marked 8 plus have slated other films for inaccuracies? Here's the truth. Mank did the first two drafts at Victorville, but there were seven drafts in all. plus the revisions as the shooting progressed. It was brave to shoot in b/w, but you get the impression in the end it disappears up its own backside.

Title: MANK
Comments: Despite the perfectly tonal black-and-white cinematography, the fictional story about the background and process of screenwriter Herman Mankiewicz' Citizen Kane script gets lost in overly clever word play. Yes, it is a story about writers, but the decision to have the actors deliver their lines in the rhythm of old style films, leaves the viewer annoyed rather than amused. These artistic choices on the part of the director distract from the overall storytelling, rather than contributing to it.The acting was unfortunately uneven. With the exception of Amanda Seyfried's Marion Davis, the female characters are weakly performed and less memorable than the pasties on one of the steno workers in one of the earlier scenes.As for the men, Charles Dance as Hearst is terrific as the kingly mannered king maker who enjoys playing at politics. Gary Oldman, as always, brings a solidity to the film as Mankiewicz that many of the actors cannot muster: I'm looking at you Lily Collins. I'd have like to have seen more Orson Welles, the ambitious dynamic force that got the film to screen, but I suppose that would have detracted from the focus on Mankiewicz.I feel this is picky in a film celebrating the writer of one of cinema's best movies, but it could have used better editing.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Greatest dialogoues a film had in a while.
A masterpiece of cinematography.
A brilliant cast that could not be arranged better.

Title: MANK
Comments: Acting is perfect, directing is outstanding, score is fantastic and very very entertaining...best movie of the year for me

Title: MANK
Comments: With Mank, Fincher is able to capture the essence of Citizen Kane. It is widely regarded that Citizen Kane is one of the greatest movies ever made. Orson Welles managed to create this masterpiece during his first spin in moviemaking: writing, directing, and producing it on his own. What many people don't know, and what Fincher is trying to tell us, is that the screenplay was primarily written by Herman J. Mankiewicz. Starring as the titular Mank is Gary Oldman, in another Oscar worthy role. Tom Burke plays the legendary Orson Welles, portraying him as kind of an annoying show off. Of course, Welles had a right to be prideful, he was making the greatest movie ever made. Fincher's Directing is sublime, I'm hoping with this he can finally win the coveted best director Oscar, which he surprisingly hasn't won yet. Also the cinematography is spot on, perfectly matching the feel of Citizen Kane. Ultimately this is a must watch for movie fans and i would be very surprised if we don't see plenty of this movie during awards season.

Title: MANK
Comments: Para mi es insufrible. Bien a nivel tcnico y en direccin. Pero Gary oldman sobre acta y la pelcula se hace larga y tediosa.

Title: MANK
Comments: It's hard to get me excited for movies these days and even with this one I wasn't sure what to expect. Black and white? Forget about it. However, this movie really delivered. Fincher's got massive balls for doing this film. He took a big risk making it, but it sure did pay off.It's a very talky and literary movie: people who appreciate screenwriting will totally dig it.The only reason I would imagine people disliking it is because of the black and white or because of Mank's political views.Whether you like it or not, this is one of Fincher's best.

Title: MANK
Comments: Not a film buff, but a history buff. I've seen Citizen Kane, because you have to see the "greatest movie ever made" but not sure I every really understood it all. That was decades ago.But Mank places Citizen Kane in its historical context. You can already see the fault lines that led in later years to the "Hollywood Ten", the debates about what Hitler was going to mean to the world, the whole Hollywood scene of the 1930's when all of this was new, was beautifully portrayed. Upton Sinclair's quixotic (an adjective deliberately suggested in Mank) End Poverty In California campaign which did lead to Social Security being passed, even though Sinclair lost the election.Yet I suppose that those who know little or nothing about this period would find the film boring, as many other reviewers have.

Title: MANK
Comments: As of now the best movie of 2020 for me, Gary Oldman, and Amanda Seyfried both gave amazing performances. And the directing, cinematography, and score were all amazing. Definitely recommend.

Title: MANK
Comments: I should start off by saying I'd watch Gary Oldman read the telephone book. He's great even in bad movies. I'm familiar with 30s Hollywood. I love movies from that era and the 40s. I liked this a lot, although I did think it was a little bit too long. I was surprised by Charles Dance; I thought he really captured Hearst. I vaguely remember Upton Sinclair, so that part wasn't very interesting to me. I say, if you like the Hollywood of Irving Thalberg, Louis B. Mayer, et al., give it a go. I was t disappointed. 9 out of 10

Title: MANK
Comments:
This is definitely one of Finchers weakest films. One can see what he tried to do with the feel of the. period and all that but somehow it has not all come together. The first forty minutes, despite the amazing visuals, are dull, and the film only picks up far too late to be an engasging watch overall.
It would have been truly interesting to see how Citizen Kane came about but this film with its endless inside quips ends up alienating the viewer more than anything else.

Title: MANK
Comments: A neighbor invited me over to watch this and out of politeness I couldn't leave. It was the longest and dullest evening I've ever spent in my life. This film really belongs on the Criterion Channel for people that agonize how old movies were made. Sorry, that's not me.

Title: MANK
Comments: To me, the history of Hollywood and the making of motion pictures is as fascinating a story as the films that have been produced. Here Fincher honors that history with Mank. Gary Oldman delivers one of the finest performances of his career as Herman J. Mankiewicz a screenwriter for MGM studios. Brilliantly shot in black and white, we follow out title characters quest through studio heads, directors, producers, actors and even titans of industry to complete his best work yet. Oldman will win an Oscar for this performance.

Title: MANK
Comments: Tried to watch this but less than 30 minutes in decided to stop. A very stylized film with very stagey dialog. There was no believable interaction between the characters. Individual acting was good especially from Oldman but this would be a better stage play than what went on here. Filming was good but nothing seemed integrated on any real human level. Reminded me of Citizen Kane which was probably the point but I didn't like that movie and didn't like this one either. Seems like another self serving inside story of the Hollywood machine.

Title: MANK
Comments: Mank is primarily a biographical drama focused on Herman J. Mankiewicz, the alcoholic screenwriter for Citizen Kane, played by Gary Oldman. David Fincher directs this 1930's homage to the great Citizen Kane, choosing to shoot in black in white to increase the film's authenticity to that late era of Hollywood. The film has a special significance to Fincher, as his late father composed the screenplay decades ago, but sadly the project did not come to fruition in his lifetime. Amanda Seyfried plays Marion Davies, a friend of Mank's and the wife of William Randolph Hearst (Charles Dance), whom the character Charles Kane is based upon.Mank copies many of Citizen Kane's stylistic elements, including lighting, costumes, cinematography, and storyboarding. In Mank, we see a charismatic and well-liked man hamstrung by his addiction. The viewer gets a deep look into the duality between the character's excesses and triumphs. As in Citizen Kane, we see a "Hollywood" man on top of the world, only to be brought down to Earth by his own misgivings. The difference is that Mank finds redemption while writing his screenplay.The film takes place while Mank is bedridden with a broken leg, scrambling to complete his screenplay that would eventually become Citizen Kane. A series of flashbacks shows how Mank, once riding high as a writer for Paramount, hits rock bottom due to his alcohol induced self-destructive tendencies. Charles Kane shared a similar fate, once on the precipice of winning the gubernational election, but falls short due to the publicity of his extramarital affair, eventually withering away as a recluse in Xanadu.The opening sequences of each respective film are distinctly different, however, Mank begins with a wide shot of the clouds and open road, along with scrolling credits. Kane begins without any credits, besides Orson Welles name. After Orson Welles shows his name to the audience, there is a close-up of the "No Trespassing" sign, with an upward tilt across the chain link fence, eventually exposing Xanadu and the adjoining zoo. Fincher immediately distances himself from the character of Orson Welles, as he serves as an adversary in the plot of Mank, depicted as an angry egomaniac to complement Mank's suave charm. To this point, we often see at Mank's eye level in the film, instead of the camera angle tilted up to Orson Welles in Citizen Kane.Despite the few differences made necessary from the change in characters, we commonly see similarities in lighting and set design. In multiple scenes, we in inside of Hearst's mansion, where there are enormous spaces between the guests with flashy costumes and dcor. Mank breaks the norms of the household, often choosing to drink and invading the space of those around him with subtle insults. Hearst has a vastly oversized king's chair, similar to the chair in Xanadu in Citizen Kane. Instead of feeling sympathy for Charles Kane when he surrounds himself with his wealthy possessions, we view the extravagance as grossly absurd in Mank.The lighting in Mank is often reflective of the title character's disposition in each sequence. In flashbacks when Mank's life is on the upswing, lighting and costumes are generally lighter. In the present, when Mank is struggling to write the script and moderate his alcohol consumption, he is painted in a darker light. At a particular low point in his process, the lighting goes to black, a fade out transition to another flashback. Both the fadeout transition and the use of flashbacks are commonplace in each film.The famous Rosebud shot with the snow globe is mirrored almost exactly, but alternatively we see Mank's bottle of liquor, empty and falling to the floor after he finished its contents. In Citizen Kane, Rosebud symbolizes the youth and innocence that Kane lost and was irreparably harmed for. In Mank, we instead see the alcohol that has consumed his life and brought him to his lowest point. Both symbols impress the theme of staying honest and having restraint to lead a fulfilling life.

Title: MANK
Comments: David Fincher has created some of the great modern films. But this is one of the most slow, boring films I've ever seen. Black and white seems so pointless I don't understand the idea behind that. Doesn't help the film. If you want a film set in this period I'm sure there are a lot better films that were made in this period. Classic Oscar bait and no surprise the academy fell for it as it's all about Hollywood and it fits there agenda.

Title: MANK
Comments: I had high hopes about Mank, especially following all the current oscar buzz around it. However, it was one of the most uninspiring and boring films I have watched in recent years. Cinematically well done? Yes. Historically based? Yes. Interesting? Absolutely not. I am a massive film goer and I have watched many bad films over the years like anyone else, but this is one of the only films I have ever fell asleep watching. I could not care less about the characters or the plot. The only reason this film was made is because rich white people in Hollywood love making movies about themselves and their exclusive history. Don't waste your time.

Title: MANK
Comments: What a mess of script, it's not even about the writing of Citizen Kane. Horrible storytelling. Horrible cinematography. Save yourself time and skip it.

Title: MANK
Comments: As i'm writing this I'm only halfway through this film. A minute ago I glanced through the reviews. Many writers of the reviews don't understand the essence and meaning of the movie. First of all, Gary Oldman is acting superb. The film is made in Citizen Kane style. Camera work is flawless. And yes, you need to watch Citizen Kane first and read about that genius Orson Welles. The dialogue is fantastic. Show some effort to find out why this is a great movie! This film stands out in the enormous debris the movie companies poor out over our innocent heads.....

Title: MANK
Comments: "Citizen Kane" is one of my fave movies of all time, so I was expecting much more from this. But unless you are a connoisseur of the Hollywood history, of who the characters from this film are, you won't understand much from David Fincher's movie.Watching this movie with my wife, who unlike me, didn't go to film school and didn't study film history, you see a lot of characters the are either funny or sad and a lot of dialogue that might not make sense to you.So, unless you, the viewer, don't know much about the 1930s Hollywood, you'd find "Mank" to be a little bit boring and not making much sense. And this review is from the point of view of a person that didn't studied Hollywood or didn't even see "Citizen Kane".Otherwise, the cinematography is gorgeous. It truly takes you to the 1930s - 1940s movies, the music also, and this, to me, are the only two phases where this movie excels.

Title: MANK
Comments: As always, an exceptional Gary Oldman! The movie is relatively hard to follow and does not have cohesion, but thanks to his amazing performance, you stick to it till the end

Title: MANK
Comments: So disappointing as such a stellar cast. Fincher wants us to feel like we are in a cinema with the audio echo and grainy b/w film. Soundtrack by Trent Reznor also a massive lure. But none of it stacks up.

Title: MANK
Comments: Interesting look at old Hollywood the first 45 minutes. Wells, MGM, Hearst, fascinating historic figures. A film not to be enjoyed by common folk, but film majors and Hollywood likes. The film then takes a sudden political turn. Why?Screen play writer trying to appease future woke employers. Just tell a story and don't take a side. Pretend it's 2010.

Title: MANK
Comments:
David Fincher successfully tackles black and white cinematography with an entertaining homage to '30s era Hollywood.At the core is a bedside view of the process (and politics) that went into writing "the best film of all time", Citizen Kane, by screenwriter Herman J. Mankiewicz.Gary Oldman is, of course, insanely good.
The writing leaves plenty of space to allow conversations to feel real.
And every now and then you'll see something familiar from Citizen Kane just on the periphery.Just when you think Fincher will make another OK Computer, he decides it's time to make Kid A.

Title: MANK
Comments: Income inequality and blatant disregard for the working class may have prompted Herman J. Mankiewicz (Mank) to write a screenplay in 1940 that Orson Welles crafted into the greatest movie ever made, "Citizen Kane." With Hearst's fairy-tale lifestyle and conspicuous consumption exemplified by his monumental San Simeon Castle, Mank had the incentive to craft a compelling screenplay.You don't need to know the back story to appreciate the Netflix movie "Mank" where the writer's angst builds around W. R. Hearst's newspapers brutal propaganda against progressive author and gubernatorial candidate Upton Sinclair. Fueling Mank's fire is movie mogul L. B. Mayer, state GOP party chair, who produced phony "newsreel" interviews with "voters" that further destroy Sinclair's chances. The specter of "socialism" is the dog whistle employed then as it is now by the Republicans.Watch "Mank" in tandem with "Citizen Kane" where in an interview with the reporter "Jed," played by Joseph Cotton, the case against Hearst/Kane is candidly stated. ("He did brutal things.") "Mank" connects the dots on the CK puzzle that has entertained many for almost 80 years.

Title: MANK
Comments: I saw the film "mank"from pure curiosity...as to why a black and white film is AGAIN nominated for another oscar. It didn't take me by surprise  that my instinct was right. Except from some good moments of the main characters like Gary Oldman as "Mank", the writer of citizen Cane and some nostalgic scenes............

Title: MANK
Comments: I soon as saw the film's opening credits, it immediately put a smile on my face Upon finishing the film, I immediately watched it again.

Title: MANK
Comments: I'd like to quote Mank saying: "you can't resume a man's life in a 2 hours picture" sure u can't, but David & Jack Fincher, could've done a much better job with not portraying Orson and Herman as enemies or rivals, but rather as friends, because that's how they was. We can see that Mank criticized W.R Hearst and blamed him for everything bad that happened in this world, but we can also see Mank as a deeply troubled person, jealous of course, because why would a beautiful woman like Marion love a jerk like Hearst, and why a jerk like Hearst must have all he wants when Mank risk to lose his job, that is half payed by Heast.How do we know that Orson Welles didn't write Citizen Kane's script? How do we know that he was not a close friend to Herman Mankiewitz?, and how do we know that socialism is that good?, and all capitalists are pigs (or crocodiles) ??These are all questions that bumped into my head when i was watching David Fincher's Mank, so i tried to dig up some truth a little.Apparently, Orson saved Herman from his suicidal drinking and also bankruptcy, he didn't want to 'exclude' him from the credits of Citizen Kane, in fact Herman played the unknown newspaper man in the film, i don't know why Netflix is portraying Orson Welles or Louis B. Mayer as monsters. but this is netflix what can we do?The plot so far isn't thrilling, Jack & David Fincher knew that, so they added a whole chapter of Herman's fictious friend Shelly blaming himself for a newsreel he made that caused his favourite candidate to lose the elections, then he killing himself, this has no meaning and makes the plot so loosy, it's obviously made to give an also fictious explanation of why Herman became alcoholic & troubled.Mank is a story about a man who's suffering from being different in a society where all the people are running after money, so he seeks sanctuary in alcohol, and sarcasm, he says when ms. Alexander (Lily Collins who played a character that has ironically, almost the same name as the real Ms. Susan Alexander, in Citizen Kane), asks him why he's never serious "i can be serious only about something funny" this is a movie about Citizen Kane, i expected a lot from Gary Oldman, and pretty much from all the cast, actors had so much opportunities to show their potential, and the most remarkable performance is by Amanda Seyfried,she portrays Susan Alexander very well (because Susan is a character made by Herman, it's known that Susan and Kane are Marion and Hearst in real life, so we should expect Susan from Marion, and Kane from Hearst), in the other hand, i expected that W.R Hearst (by Charles Dance) would be much like Foster Kane, but no we see a different person from Kane.what ruined it for me the most is that you feel like it's a movie about capitalism-socialism, not about an alcoholic screenwriter who wrote one of the greatest movies of all time.

Title: MANK

The movie tries to use what is recently interesting "40's decade-like-cinema" to attract attentions. Although producing a movie about screenwriter is a new fascinating idea.

Title: MANK
Comments: What a complex movie! exquisite acting and direction, the story it's a little fuzzy, but fulfills its goal.

Title: MANK
Comments:
What happened to Hollywood in 2020 to think that a movie like this might be a golden globe or Oscar favourite??? Really?
Gary Oldman's performance is excellent, just as one of the best actors of the last 30-40 years might be expected, but the plot? a "we never understand where this is going, let's hope i don't fall asleep" story.. everything too slow
Not a bad movie, but hard to understand where it goes from and where it goes to
Despite of it all, Gary Oldman definitely deserves an Oscar, but it's deserved from a long time
2020 was a really bad year for the entire planet, we dont need to let it be remembered to us by nominating boring films

Title: MANK
Comments:
I just finished watching this movie. I've been waiting for this movie since the beginning of 2020 . (Mank) by David fincher is a journey into Hollywoods golden age .First of all you have to watch the movie citizen Kane witch was released 1941 , because the movie explains the story of the making of this historical film Citizen Kane.Dir david fincher creates again a great movie but this time he dispensed with all colors and made a black and white film to represent the era more realistically. You may think that the film was filmed in 1940 and was presented with beautiful directorial shots and wonderful cinematic paintings showing the struggle to produce this film. The Era and everything looked like the '40s, the sound effects, light, and directing style that 1940s filmmakers were completely using.The wonderful cinematographer Erik Messerschmidt takes the responsibility of shooting the movie as it was shoot in the 1940s to realistically capture the era and was excellent and identical to the filming of the 40s to make you feel as if you went back 70 years in time to live that period.
The text is more realistic than you think, as it was written by the late Jack Fincher, father of David Fincher, before he passed away in 2003 for health reasons. Why do I say that the text is realistic because it was written by an old man about a true story of an old man writing his last story, wonderful dramatic dialogues and jokes Politics and a drama that seems like the drama of a classic movie released 70 years ago.
Yes, Oldman gave the best performance in the movie calmly, the man who reached the end of his life and excelled in the perfect role to embody the character of "Mankiewicz" in a wonderful way. In the period of the Great Depression that destroyed the economy, the staff gave a quiet performance, and the viewer may notice the calmness of actress Lily Collins, who plays the assistant Rita Alexander in a good quiet female role with the performance of actress Amanda Seyfried, who played the role of actress Marion Davies, which the film did not focus on much except that " Seyfried "did the role excellently, as actor Tom Burke played the role of director Orson Welles, beautifully and as a real persona."
The film was not disappointing, and it is definitely one of the most important films of 2020, and i expect it to participate in the Oscar race in a great way.

Title: MANK
Comments: Many are giving this film bad reviews. In my opinion it is people that don't understand film noir. A retrospect of the "so called screen play writer" of Citizen Kane". The fact that David Fincher can make this film with the feel of the 1940's with reel change ques and perfect whipes, I really don't understand what anyone has to complain about. Yes maybe we all don't know who the players are in modern times. That's up to you to figure out. "I like the way you talk"! " If I could swim, I'd be doing swimmingly". All people are complaining about no story and it being unable to follow, it doesn't take a genius to understand that this is a film about the struggle of trying to destroy your advisories. DAMN THE MAN!

Title: MANK
Comments: I struggled to get through the first half an hour, let alone the the full movie. This has to be the worst movie I've seen this year. If you enjoyed this movie, then you were obviously strapped to a chair and on something. The movie had no storyline, incredibly hard to follow and wasted a talented actor like Gary Oldman. I find it profoundly disturbing that critics would even consider this for an award. It's reminiscent of the Mr Bean movie when Mr Bean tells David that all he does for a job is sit and look at paintings. David is in ore and admiration at this. The critics are David. Terrible movie. My best advice is to spend the next 2 hours painting walls then watching this movie, you'll find it more entertaining.

Title: MANK
Comments:
Once upon a time, Steven Soderbergh attempted to make a 40s-esque noir film. The final product was a boring, convoluted missed opportunity that relied too much on quality over quantity. 'Mank' was thankfully not that. It's a modern Federico Fellini film. Certainly not his greatest, but it is one of Fincher's best. It's the writing of the late Jack Fincher that kept my eyes locked on the screen. Wish his script for 'The Aviator' was given a chance. The acting from Gary Oldman is fantastic and Oscar-worthy. The whole film is Oscar-worthy, from the production to the cinematography. Reznor and Ross's score is always an orgasm to the ears. Yes, you read that correctly. Maybe a tad be too long, but it's a film that I'll rewatch all this month.
Follow my insta filmgoer2011 and my letterboxd ISAACALVARADO

Title: MANK

Title: MANK
Comments: Checks all the boxes and achieves what it set out to do... honor to the master-film Citizen Kane. It's rare that a film is as fine as this. Very well done with all of the subtle layers one would expect of a film this ambitious.
